thag9.1:1.2: yet an ignorant ordinary person is bound to them.”
thag9.1:1.3: When an astute person fully understands this, and they are mindful, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:1.4: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:2.1: When clinging, the carrier of suffering,
thag9.1:2.2: and craving, the carrier of this painful mass of proliferation,
thag9.1:2.3: are destroyed, and one is mindful, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:2.4: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:3.1: When the eightfold way, so full of grace,
thag9.1:3.2: the supreme path, cleanser of all corruptions,
thag9.1:3.3: is seen with wisdom; and one is mindful, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:3.4: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:4.1: When one develops that peaceful state,
thag9.1:4.3: cleanser of all corruptions, cutter of fetters and bonds:
thag9.1:4.4: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:5.1: When the thunder-cloud rumbles in the sky,
thag9.1:5.2: while the rain pours on the path of birds everywhere,
thag9.1:5.3: and a monk has gone to a mountain cave, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:5.4: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:6.1: When sitting on a riverbank covered in flowers,
thag9.1:6.2: garlanded with brightly colored forest plants,
thag9.1:6.3: one is truly happy, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:6.4: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:7.1: When it is midnight in a lonely forest,
thag9.1:7.2: and the sky rains, and the lions roar,
thag9.1:7.3: and a monk has gone to a mountain cave, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:7.4: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:8.1: When one’s own thoughts have stopped,
thag9.1:8.2: between two mountains, sheltered inside a cleft,
thag9.1:8.3: without stress or heartlessness, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:8.4: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:9.1: When one is happy, destroyer of stains, heartlessness, and sorrow,
thag9.1:9.2: free of obstructions, entanglements, and thorns,
thag9.1:9.3: and with all defilements annihilated, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:9.4: there is no greater pleasure than this.
